February is Black History Montha time to reflect on the profound contributions, achievements, and struggles of Black Americans throughout US history. At the Bill of Rights Institute, we honor the voices and stories that have shaped our nation's journey toward equality and justice. Through resources like primary source documents, videos, and lesson plans, we provide educators and students with tools to explore the legacy of civil rights, activism, and leadership in America. Did you know you can use a Donor Advised Fund (DAF) to support civic and history education? A DAF is a flexible, tax-advantaged way to give back, allowing you to make charitable contributions and recommend grants over time. By directing your DAF to the Bill of Rights Institute, you can help empower students and educators with free resources to explore the founding principles of our nation. Make an impact today! Civics education is an opportunity to nurture empathy, respect, and inclusion in the classroom,  says Bridget Jordan, BRI Teacher Fellow. Growing up, Bridget dreamed of becoming a brain surgeon, but her true calling emerged when she discovered her passion for working with children. Now, as an ESOL teacher at Baltimore Highlands Elementary, Bridget is empowering her multilingual students to connect with civics and history in meaningful ways. Through BRI's Teacher Fellowship, Bridget has transformed her teaching strategies to make civics accessible for diverse learners. Read more about her story, here  https://lnkd.in/efd9PJwN.  #BillofRightsInstitute  #BRI  #teacherfellowship
